BryanCutler commented on issue #4200: ARROW-5206: [Java] Add APIs in MessageSerializer to directly serialize/deserialize ArrowBuf
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4200#issuecomment-489738417
 
 
   @tianchen92 , I'm not quite sure these APIs add much value because an `ArrowBuf` can be written directly with the `WriteChannel` (you can take a slice before to only write a chunk), or read directly with a `ReadChannel`.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

tianchen92 commented on issue #4200: ARROW-5206: [Java] Add APIs in MessageSerializer to directly serialize/deserialize ArrowBuf
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4200#issuecomment-489880083
 
 
   @BryanCutler Thanks a lot for your comments, I think you are right, we can read/write ArrowBuf through WriteChannel.write(ByteBuffer buffer).
   Ask an unrelated question, is there any way to directly serialize/deserialize ValueVector? If not, can we add these APIs? as I described in ARROW-5224. Thanks!
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

BryanCutler commented on issue #4200: ARROW-5206: [Java] Add APIs in MessageSerializer to directly serialize/deserialize ArrowBuf
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4200#issuecomment-490588972
 
 
   @tianchen92 the usual way to serialize a ValueVector is by adding the Field to a `VectorSchemaRoot` and serializing it to a RecordBatch. This produces a standard IPC message that can be exchanged with other Arrow implementations. It is possible to just serialize a single vector, but it would probably have to be deserialized in Java as well, and I don't know if this adds much value. If you have a use case for this though, please go ahead and make another jira.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description:
It seems there no APIs to directly write ArrowBuf to OutputStream or read ArrowBuf from InputStream. These APIs may be helpful when users use Vectors directly instead of RecordBatch, in this case, provide APIs to serialize/deserialize dataBuffer/validityBuffer/offsetBuffer is necessary.

I would like to work on this and make it my first contribution to Arrow. What do you think?
fields.summary: [Java] Add APIs in MessageSerializer to directly serialize/deserialize ArrowBuf
